meta_description: Since 1972, the gleaming white walls of the Art Museum of South Texas have been a landmark on the Corpus Christi Bay. Designed by Philip Johnson, the three-level facility is constructed of poured white concrete and shell aggregate. Expansive windows provide stunning views of the Corpus Christi Bay. An addition completed in October 2006 doubled the Museum’s size, adding new gallery spaces, an expanded Museum Store and a new café that overlooks Corpus Christi Bay and the ship channel.
admission_text:
## ADMISSION

The Art Museum of South Texas brings the world of art at affordable rates. Students with a school ID enjoy additional discounts.

Members – FREE  
TAMU-CC Students – FREE  
Ages 12 and Under – FREE

Museums For All (SNAP Benefits Recipients) – FREE

Students – $6  
Adults – $10  
Seniors – $8  
Military – $8

**First Friday of the Month:**  
First Friday: Presented by Kleberg Bank  
Free Admission from 10 a.m.–9 p.m.

**Second Saturday of the Month:**  
Second Saturday: Presented by Art Bridges Foundation  
Free Admission from 10 a.m.–5 p.m.

**Third Thursday of the Month:**  
Third Thursday: Presented by AEP  
Free Admission All Day, event begins 5:30 p.m.–9 p.m.

### MUSEUM HOURS

Monday: CLOSED  
Tue – Sat: 10:00 – 5:00 p.m.  
Sunday: 1:00 – 5:00 p.m.

*Holiday Hours/ Emergency Closures Announced on social platforms, via email and on the AMST homepage if possible*

### Accessibility

All art galleries are wheelchair accessible. A limited number of wheelchairs are available for guest use. Restrooms on the main floor of the Philip Johnson Building and the Miller building are wheelchair accessible. Please call [361-825-3500](http://web.archive.org/web/20250725065219/tel:361-825-3500) for special arrangements for visitors with physical limitations. ADA compliant parking in every parking lot and compliance with ADA service animal regulations. [Click here for full service animal policy.](http://web.archive.org/web/20250725065219/https://www.tamucc.edu/governance/ru...
